note.p: Paris, Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal (Bibliothèque nationale de France), 5226
Gothic, written in 2 columns of 36 lines, 1 scribe. Folios 96v-120v, 140r-141v, 152r-154v replacements by a 15th-century scribe
2 artists, Richard de Montbaston (quires 1-2, 4) and Jeanne de Montbaston (quire 3) (this is according to Rouse and Rouse, see bibliography)

1 double-column panel miniature in colors and gold, with a foliate bar border incorporating a hare, dog, birds, a grotesque head, and a large decorated initial on f. 1r; 23 single-column panel miniatures in colors which have pink, blue and gold frames patterned in white and outlined in black with gold boxes at corners and heart-shaped leaf extenders (ff. 1r, 2r (x2), 2v (x2), 3r, 3v, 4r, 4v (x2), 5r, 5v, 6v, 7r, 9r, 12r, 13v, 14r, 15v, 17r, 22r, 24v, 28r, 31r.) Champie initials throughout.
265 x 197 mm (this measurement is from Langlois)
French; red moroccco covers with gilt fillet border, raised spine bands, gilt ornament and lettering on spine, marbled endpapers.
Louis César de La Baume Le Blanc, duc de la Vallière (1708-1780), 18th century?; Bibliothèque de Paulmy, late 18th century; Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, 19th century (after 1797).
Corrections and champie initials by the 15th-century scribe. 19th-century description of text and ms written on flyealf: frontmatter.flyleaf.02v
1. Henry Martin, Catalogue des manuscrits de la bibliothèque de l'Arsenal, III, p. 337
3. Richard H. and Mary A. Rouse, Manuscripts and their makers: commercial book producers in medieval Paris, 1200-1500 (Turnhout: Harvey Miller, 2000) II, pp. 204-205
